header.tagline: A Path to Equitable Learning for Every Child

about.intro: We are not just a platform; we are a movement. EdusiaHub was born from the conviction that every child in Indonesia, regardless of their ability, deserves a quality education that unlocks a bright future. This is why we exist.

about.challenge1_desc: The majority of teachers feel unprepared to handle classroom diversity without adequate training and support.
about.challenge2_desc: Assistive technology and disability-friendly infrastructure are still scarce in many public schools.
about.challenge3_desc: The biggest barriers are often not physical but mindsets that limit the potential of children with special needs.
about.challenge4_desc: Good regulations often remain on paper and fail to address the root problems in schools.
about.solution1_desc: We provide a practical and relevant digital training platform, turning teachers into agents of inclusive change.
about.solution2_desc: We connect schools, government, and industry to co-create real, sustainable solutions.
about.solution3_desc: We turn data into powerful stories to drive better policies and inspire tangible action.
about.vision_text: Envisioning an Indonesia where every classroom reflects the nation's diversityâ€”a place where all children learn, grow, and achieve their dreams together, leaving no one behind.
about.mission1_desc: Developing cutting-edge digital tools and resources to support personalized learning.
about.mission2_desc: Forging strong networks among all stakeholders to accelerate the adoption of inclusive practices.
about.mission3_desc: Changing public perception and fostering a culture of inclusivity through impactful campaigns and advocacy.

hero.title: Shaping the Future of Inclusive Education in Indonesia
hero.subtitle: Welcome to the movement to fulfill the promise of inclusive education. In line with Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 4, we believe every child deserves a quality learning opportunity.

point1.title: Fact
point1.description: Nearly 30% of children with disabilities in Indonesia do not have access to education.

point2.title: Gap
point2.description: Many schools are not yet ready, with only a small fraction having trained guidance teachers.

point3.title: Our Vision
point3.description: Bridging this gap with a digital platform for learning and developmental screening, empowering teachers, parents, and, most importantly, every child.
